correction_response:
This tweet is misinformed. The UK did not ban Fox News. The decision to stop broadcasting in the UK was made by Fox News itself in 2017 due to commercial reasons, as it had only a few thousand viewers across the day in the UK. The UK's broadcast regulatory agency, Ofcom, confirmed that Fox News made the decision to discontinue. No record of Ofcom ever bringing sanctions against Fox News or revoking their broadcasting license has been found.

- For more than 15 years, Fox News was broadcast in the U.K. on satellite television, with the broadcast license being held by Fox News Network LLC. However, the company withdrew from the U.K. in August 2017 and surrendered its broadcasting license in November of that year. At the time, a spokesperson for Fox News told multiple news outlets that that voluntary decision was made for commercial reasons and because "it averages only a few thousand viewers across the day in the U.K." In other words, neither Ofcom nor any other U.K. authority "banned" Fox News — the company made the decision to withdraw from the U.K. in 2017 because not enough people were watching.
